definitions.definition: To put up by the fitting together of materials or parts.
definitions.example: to erect a house or a fort

definitions.definition: To cause to stand up or out.
To raise and place in an upright or perpendicular position; to set upright; to raise.
definitions.example: to erect a pole, a flagstaff, a monument, etc.

definitions.definition: To lift up; to elevate; to exalt; to magnify.
To animate; to encourage; to cheer.
To cast or draw up (a figure of the heavens, horoscope etc.).
To set up as an assertion or consequence from premises, etc.
To set up or establish; to found; to form; to institute.
